content: आत्मन् {%<ab>m.</ab>%} [अत्-मनिण् <ls>Uṇ. 4. 152</ls> said to be from अन् to breathe also] {@--1@} The soul, the individual soul, the breath, the principle of life and sensation; किमात्मना यो न जितेंद्रियो भवेत् <ls>H. 1</ls>; आत्मानं रथिनं विद्धि शरीरं रथमेव तु <ls>Kaṭh.</ls> (In <ls>H. 4. 87</ls> आत्मन् is compared to a river). {@--2@} Self, oneself; in this sense mostly used reflexively for all three persons and in the singular number, masculine gender, whatever be the gender or number of the noun to which it refers; अनया चिंतयात्मापि मे न प्रतिभाति <ls>Ratn. 1</ls>; आश्रमदर्शनेन आत्मानं पुनीमहे <ls>Ś. 1</ls>; गुप्तं ददृशुरात्मानं सर्वाः स्वप्तेषु वामनैः <ls>R. 10. 60</ls>, <ls n="R.">4. 35</ls>, <ls n="R.">14. 57</ls>; <ls>Ku. 6. 20</ls>; देवी… प्राप्तप्रसवमात्मानं गंगादेव्यां विमुंचति <ls>U. 7. 2</ls>; गोपायंति कुलस्त्रिय आत्मानमात्मना <ls>Mb.</ls>; <ls>K. 107</ls>; sometimes used in <ab>pl.</ab> also; <ls>Śi. 17. 19</ls>; <ls>Māl. 8.</ls> {@--3@} Supreme deity and soul of the universe, Supreme Soul, Brahma; तस्माद्वा एतस्मादात्मन आकाशः संभूतः <ls>Up.</ls>; <ls>U. 1. 1</ls>; <ls>Ms. 1. 15</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">12. 24.</ls> {@--4@} Essence, nature; काव्यस्यात्मा ध्वनिः <ls>S. D.</ls>, see आत्मक below. {@--5@} Character, peculiarity. {@--6@} The natural temperament or disposition. {@--7@} The person or whole body (considered as one and opposed to the separate members of it); स्थितः सर्वोन्नतेनोर्वी क्रांत्वा मेरुरिवात्मना <ls>R. 1. 14</ls>; योस्यात्मनः कारयिता <ls>Ms. 12. 12</ls>; <ls>Ki. 9. 66.</ls> {@--8@} Mind, intellect; मंदात्मन्, नष्टात्मन्, महात्मन् &c. {@--9@} The understanding; <ab>cf.</ab> आत्मसंपन्न, आत्मवत् &c. {@--10@} Thinking faculty, the faculty of thought and reason. {@--11@} Spirit, vitality, courage. {@--12@} Form, image; आत्मानमाधाय <ls>Ku. 3. 24</ls> assuming his own form; <ls n="Ku.">2. 61</ls>; संरोपितेप्यात्मनि <ls>Ś. 6. 23</ls> myself being implanted in her. {@--13@} A son; आत्मा वै पुत्रनामासि. {@--14@} Care, efforts, pain. {@--15@} The sun. {@--16@} Fire. {@--17@} Wind, air. आत्मन् is used as the last member of <ab>comp.</ab> in the sense of ‘made or consisting of’; see आत्मक. The form त्मन् is also found to be used; कृतार्थं मन्यते त्नानं <ls>Mb.</ls> [<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Gr.</ab> {%atmos%}, {%aitmen%}]
